channel.title: Randall Garrison
channel.description: Recent news about Randall Garrison, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Alberni Valley News
item.description:
MP's bill aims to protect Sproat Lake
Published: September 05, 2013 1:00 PM Updated: September 05, 2013 1:16 PM. Federal NDP MP Randall Garrison, whose riding is Esquimalt-Juan de Fuca, will introduce legislation in the upcoming session of Parliament to restore protection to Sproat Lake.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Happy Labour Day! and congrats to all Unifor members on their great new union! Time to move Canadians forward together! #cdnpoi #ndp

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Nothing quite like the Whistler Blackcomb Peak 2 Peak Gondola at 436 m above the ground even if through the clouds today #whistler #yyj #ndp

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: For me trying to practice love, hope and optimism are the best ways to pay tribute to Jack Layton two years on. #ndp

item.description: At official opening of India Canada Mela #yyj come down to Centennial Square for great food music and dance

item.title: Mentioned by Victoria News
item.description:
Politicians launch petition to save the Centre of the Universe
Science and technology critic Kennedy Stewart (MP Burnaby-Douglas), Saanich South MLA Lana Popham and Esquimalt-Juan de Fuca MP Randall Garrison sign the petition asking the government to restore funding for the Centre of the Universe, the public ...

item.title: Mentioned by Victoria News
item.description:
MP Randall Garrison credits police agencies attempted terrorist attack
Randall Garrison, MP for Esquimalt-Juan de Fuca is pleased with the co-operative work done by police agencies that worked together to foil a terrorism plot. Two Surrey residents are accused of planting pressure cooker bombs outside the B.C. legislature on ...

item.title: Mentioned by Xtra.ca
item.description:
C-279 vote stalled by Conservative senators, Mitchell claims
After months of lobbying and mud slinging in the House of Commons, NDP MP Randall Garrison's private member's bill C-279 appears to have stalled at the hands of Marjory LeBreton, the Conservative leader of the government in the Senate. The federal ...
